articles.headline: Illegal in Massachusetts: Asking Your Salary in a Job Interview
articles.snippet: A law taking effect in 2018 requires employers to offer a compensation figure upfront in an effort to end the wage gap between men and women.
articles.abstract: A law taking effect in 2018 requires employers to offer a compensation figure upfront in an effort to end the wage gap between men and women.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a groundbreaking effort to close the wage gap between men and women, Massachusetts has become the first state to bar employers from asking about applicants’ salaries before offering them a job.

articles.headline: China, Not Silicon Valley, Is Cutting Edge in Mobile Tech
articles.snippet: American tech companies study Chinese users and apps as a smartphone revolution changes how people interact, buy products and manage their money.
articles.abstract: American tech companies study Chinese users and apps as a smartphone revolution changes how people interact, buy products and manage their money.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Snapchat and Kik, the messaging services, use bar codes that look like drunken checkerboards to connect people and share information with a snap of their smartphone cameras. Facebook is working on adding the ability to hail rides and make payments within its Messenger app. Facebook and Twitter have begun live-streaming video.

articles.headline: Big Banks Make a Pitch for Hearts and Minds
articles.snippet: Citigroup’s ad campaign for the Olympics showcases the benefits of large global banks, and other big banks are trying to soften their image.
articles.abstract: Citigroup’s ad campaign for the Olympics showcases the benefits of large global banks, and other big banks are trying to soften their image.
articles.lead_paragraph: At both the Democratic and Republican conventions, the nation’s biggest banks were again cast as the bad guys, criticized as being too big and too risky.

articles.headline: Underwater in the Las Vegas Desert, Years After the Housing Crash
articles.snippet: More than eight years after rotten loans and plunging home values made Las Vegas the center of the housing crisis, thousands of people have yet to recover.
articles.abstract: More than eight years after rotten loans and plunging home values made Las Vegas the center of the housing crisis, thousands of people have yet to recover.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Michael Hutchings bet it all when he built his 3,300-square-foot dream home on a strip of rock-strewn desert gazing west toward the Las Vegas Strip. He had made a fortune building custom homes as Vegas boomed higher and higher, and for his own, he chose red Spanish tiles, wrought iron and silky white plaster. A guesthouse? Sure. Swimming pool? Of course.

articles.headline: Ignoring Advice, Donald Trump Presses Attack on Khan Family and G.O.P. Leaders
articles.snippet: The continuing attacks threaten to shatter Mr. Trump’s uneasy alliance with the Republican Party at the outset of the general election
articles.abstract: The continuing attacks threaten to shatter Mr. Trump’s uneasy alliance with the Republican Party at the outset of the general election
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump’s unabashed and continuing hostility toward the parents of a slain Muslim American soldier, and his attacks on Republican leaders who have rebuked him for it, threaten to shatter his uneasy alliance with the Republican Party at the outset of the general election campaign.

articles.headline: How a Secretive Branch of ISIS Built a Global Network of Killers
articles.snippet: A jailhouse interview with a German man who joined the Islamic State reveals the workings of a unit whose lieutenants are empowered to plan attacks around the world.
articles.abstract: A jailhouse interview with a German man who joined the Islamic State reveals the workings of a unit whose lieutenants are empowered to plan attacks around the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: BREMEN, Germany — Believing he was answering a holy call, Harry Sarfo left his home in the working-class city of Bremen last year and drove for four straight days to reach the territory controlled by the Islamic State in Syria.

articles.headline: Mike Pence Splits With Donald Trump on Paul Ryan Endorsement
articles.snippet: Mr. Pence openly split with his running mate a day after Mr. Trump said he was not ready to endorse Mr. Ryan.
articles.abstract: Mr. Pence openly split with his running mate a day after Mr. Trump said he was not ready to endorse Mr. Ryan.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gov. Mike Pence, aligning himself with the Republican establishment rather than his running mate, broke with Donald J. Trump on Wednesday by endorsing Speaker Paul D. Ryan’s re-election bid, a day after Mr. Trump roiled the party by declaring that he was not yet ready to support the speaker.
articles.byline: By Ashley Parker, Maggie Haberman and Jonathan Martin
